entry.title: Fourth Post
entry.content: Fourth Post H1 Looks like the third post didin’t send to the correct place but I can see it in the preview, along with an updated theme. I enjoyed my week here at Fullstack and am looking forward to the rest of my time here. Some of the Ruby has been difficult. While I didn’t do most of the testing, it didn’t look so difficult when we went over the problems and I was able to see how the programs ran. I think that with time I will become more aware of what Ruby can do and how to make it happen. I have since begun the Haiku project, which doesn’t seem as difficult as I had initially thought. It all comes down to getting Ruby to do what I need it do. All that’s left for me is to find the right commands. Pair programming worked out well. I liked being a part of a team and it was interesting to see how Vin and Scott think in relation to the code. I found that Vin and I had a more similar approach. I am interested in working with the rest of the students but feel I should be more prepared next time, in order to contribute more to the code.

entry.title: Email Update
entry.content: Working on Ruby to send email out to users on a given list in regards to updates of this blog. Adding another post to help with testing.

entry.title: First Post
entry.content:
This is the second try of the first post H1

I had a problem getting Rails set up last night but it worked today when Nimit tried. Still doesn’t look like things are going to work but I will try.
